[[Image:Real Casa de Correos - 03.jpg|thumb|[[Puerta del Sol]], [[Madrid]]]] [[File:Raïm de Cap d'Any.jpg|thumb|]] The '''Twelve Grapes'''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://hemerotecadigital.bne.es/issue.vm?id=0000175619|title=Hemeroteca Digital. Biblioteca Nacional de España|website=hemerotecadigital.bne.es|access-date=2018-08-29}}</ref> ([[Spanish language|Sp]]. ''Las doce uvas de la suerte'', "The twelve grapes of luck") is a [[Spain|Spanish]] tradition that dates back from at least 1895<ref>{{cite news |newspaper=La Correspondencia de España |location=Madrid |volume=XLVII |issue=13.844 |date=1 January 1896 |page=3}}</ref> but became established in 1909. In December of that year, some [[alicante]]se vine growers popularized this custom to better sell huge amounts of [[grape]]s from an excellent harvest.
The tradition consists of eating a grape with each [[Bell (instrument)|bell]] strike at midnight of December 31. According to the tradition, that leads to a year of prosperity.<ref name="Spicer">{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fMuqhSpY6u8C |title=Festivals of Western Europe |first=Dorothy Gladys |last=Spicer |year=2008 |publisher=[[BiblioBazaar]] |date=22 February 2008 |pages=256 |isbn=9781437520163}}</ref> In some areas, it is believed that the tradition wards away witches and general evil,<ref name="Spicer"/><ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=wZsguJDgxRoC |title=Celebrations: a joyous guide to the holidays from past to present |first=Jim |last=McCann |author-link=Jim McCann (writer) |first2=Jeanne |last2=Benedict |year=2001 |publisher=[[Penguin Group]] (USA) Incorporated |pages=161 |isbn=9781557883735}}</ref> although this "magic" is treated like an old heritage, and in modern days it's viewed as a cultural tradition to welcome the new year.
There are two main places where people gather to eat the grapes: with family after the dinner or in the main squares around the country, the [[Puerta del Sol]] in [[Madrid]] being the most famous place to do it.
The twelve grapes are linked to the [[Puerta del Sol]] tower clock, where this tradition started and from where the change of year is always broadcast.
This tradition was also adopted in places with a broad cultural relation with [[Spain]] and Latin American countries, as well as Hispanic communities in the [[United States]]. The [[Philippines]] has adopted the tradition as well.
This [[tradition]] is part of the Hispanic [[Christmas]] festivities.

{{More citations needed|date=November 2009}} {{Infobox video game |title= V-Tech Rampage |image=V-Tech Rampage title screen.png |image_size=256px |caption=Title screen |developer = Ryan Lambourn |release = |genre = [[Action game|Action]] |modes = [[Single-player]] |platforms = [[Adobe Flash Player]] }} '''''V-Tech Rampage''''' is a controversial amateur [[action game|action]] [[video game]] that recreates the 2007 [[Virginia Tech shooting]] on the campus of [[Virginia Tech]] in [[Blacksburg, Virginia|Blacksburg]], [[Virginia]], [[United States]]. The game was created by 21-year-old Ryan Lambourn from [[Australia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/games/outrage-over-virginia-tech-game/2007/05/16/1178995212668.html |title=Outrage over Virginia Tech game - Games - Technology |publisher=smh.com.au |date=2007-05-16 |accessdate=2013-10-26}} The [[Adobe Flash|Flash]]-based game came to light when it was uploaded to [[Newgrounds]] using Lambourn's screen name Master PiGPEN. The previous prominent virtual [[school shooting]] reenactment, ''[[Super Columbine Massacre RPG!]]'', is a [[role-playing video game]] and has received praise for artistic merit as well as condemnation. ''V-Tech Rampage'' was created to be offensive{{cite web|url=http://www.destructoid.com/virtual-school-shootings-interviewing-two-of-the-most-hated-game-creators-alive-31610.phtml |title=Virtual school shootings: interviewing two of the most hated game creators alive |publisher=Destructoid |date= |accessdate=2013-10-26}} without redeeming value. In 2013, Lambourn caused further controversy with his game ''The Slaying Of Sandy Hook Elementary'', which re-created the [[Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting]].{{cite web|author=Baier, Bret |url=http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/special-report-bret-baier/blog/2013/11/20/outrage-over-sandy-hook-shooting-video-game|title=Outrage Over Sandy Hook Shooting Video Game |publisher=Fox News |date=2013-11-20 |accessdate=2013-11-22}} Unlike ''V-Tech Rampage'', however, ''The Slaying Of Sandy Hook Elementary'' was created to support [[gun politics in the United States|gun control laws]].{{cite web|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2013/11/20/critics-furious-over-online-game-reenacting-sandy-hook-massacre/|title=Critics Furious Over Online Game Re-Enacting Sandy Hook Massacre |publisher=CBS New York |date=2013-11-20 |accessdate=2013-11-22}} ==Gameplay== The game is a one-person work released weeks{{how much|date=October 2018}} after the Virginia Tech massacre. Its graphics and control are both intentionally and amusingly clumsy. The player controls [[Seung-Hui Cho]], the killer, through "3 levels of stealth and murder!" in a slanted overhead view. In the first level, the player must walk across Virginia Tech campus to shoot Emily J. Hilscher, Cho's real life first victim, without killing too many other people or scaring Emily away. Emily's death is witnessed by Ryan Clark, Cho's second victim, who also must be killed. In the second, he must walk across the same campus while avoiding the searchlights of police investigators. This is the only section with appreciable challenge. In the third, he barricades the exit of a school building and must shoot everyone inside in 90 seconds before the police arrive to arrest him. During this level, a song created by Lambourn plays while audio clips praise or laugh at murder, or scold the player for merely wounding. [[Liviu Librescu]] is the only real victim to appear in this segment. The game finishes with Cho's suicide, which occurs when the player presses the shoot button. Cho monologues about mission goals and can also speak to other characters, whose reactions differ depending on whether they're fleeing Cho or not. The game's dialogue has occasional grammar or spelling errors, and is riddled with obscenities, insults, racist terms, scatological references and offers of sex from female characters in exchange for their lives. ==Events== Lambourn offered to remove the game if he received $2,000 in "donations." For an additional $1,000, he offered to apologize.
Attention angry people: I will take this game down from newgrounds (the games website) if the donation amount reaches $1000 US. I'll take it down from here [his website] if it reaches $2000 US, and I will apologise if it reaches $3000 US.
Lambourn later retracted the offer to remove the game, stating:
...the donation thing is there as a joke against all the people commanding me to take my game down. I didn't think anyone would donate money to it and so far my paypal account has proven me right...{{cite web|url=http://gamepolitics.com/2007/05/15/v-tech-rampage-creator-demands-payment-to-remove-game/ |title=V-Tech Rampage Creator Demands Payment to Remove Game |publisher=GamePolitics |date= |accessdate=2013-10-26}}
In 2013, a "[[RIAA]] edition" was created, with the original tracks removed, due to copyright infringement with the RIAA. This has replaced the original version on Newgrounds, The original edition was until recently available on Lambourn's site, however it has since been removed due to further threats from the RIAA. Now the RIAA edition is the only available one on his site, with the title music "Hey, Hey, Hey, Fuck The RIAA" on a looped track. However the unedited version can still be found.{{cite web|url=http://gameswtf.com/2262/Virginia_Tech_Shooting_Game/Action_Games/free_flash_game.html |title=Virginia Tech Shooting Game |publisher=Gameswtf.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-26}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesforwork.com/games/play-5635-Virginia_Tech_Rampage-Flash_Game |title=Virginia Tech Rampage Games - Over 20,000 Free Games - 10 Added Every Weekday |publisher=Gamesforwork.com |date=2007-06-20 |accessdate=2013-10-26}}{{cite web|url=http://googumproduce.com/flash/vtech.swf |title=V-Tech Rampage : InstructionS |publisher=Web.archive.org |accessdate=2013-10-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120209085128/http://googumproduce.com/flash/vtech.swf |archivedate=February 9, 2012 }} The MP3 of the music in question can also be acquired.[https://web.archive.org/web/20070620234353/http://googumproduce.com/musicdl.php?n=kekeke] ==Impact== The game was compared to ''[[Super Columbine Massacre RPG!]]'',[http://blogcritics.org/archives/2007/05/14/152155.php ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070521204518/http://blogcritics.org/archives/2007/05/14/152155.php |date=May 21, 2007 }} due to the re-creation of a mass murder in which the player controls the killer through a video game. [[Danny Ledonne]], creator of ''Super Columbine Massacre RPG!'' posted a comment on Lambourn's website:
Inevitably, comparisons between [''Super Columbine Massacre RPG!''] and [''V-Tech Rampage''] are being made right now... For myself I wish to point out that [''Super Columbine Massacre RPG!''] was never a for-profit endeavor and thus I never posted statements like that which is on the [''V-Tech Rampage''] game's homepage (...) I would like to ask bloggers to consider not whether a game about the Virginia Tech shooting SHOULD be made but how we might go about making a game that accomplishes more than [''V-Tech Rampage''] does with the subject matter.{{cite web|url=http://gamepolitics.com/2007/05/15/super-columbine-creator-comments-on-v-tech-game/ |title=Super Columbine Creator Comments on V-Tech Game |publisher=GamePolitics |date= |accessdate=2013-10-26}}
New York State Senator [[Andrew Lanza]], chair of the Senate Task Force on Youth Violence and the Entertainment Industry requested that the gaming community boycott the game.{{cite web |last=Arendt |first=Susan |url=http://blog.wired.com/games/2007/05/new_york_senato.html |title=New York Senator Criticizes V-Tech Rampage, GTA IV | Game|Life | Wired.com |publisher=Blog.wired.com |date=2007-05-17 |accessdate=2013-10-26 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081013073625/http://blog.wired.com/games/2007/05/new_york_senato.html |archivedate=October 13, 2008}} However, video game publications wrote of concerns about backlashes against video games and wrote that this game was created by an individual, not the gaming industry.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.silive.com/news/advance/index.ssf?/base/news/1179402340128350.xml&coll=1 |title=Staten Island Advance Print Edition - - Staten Island Advance |publisher=SILive.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-26}} [[GamesRadar]].com ranked the game as 4th in the ''Top 7 Most Evil Games''.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.gamesradar.com/the-top-7-most-evil-games/ |title=The Top 7... Most Evil Games |publisher=GamesRadar |date=2012-06-23 |accessdate=2013-10-26}} ==See also== {{Portal|Australia|Video games}} *''[[Super Columbine Massacre RPG!]]'' ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://googumproduce.com/vtech/ Game at googumproduce.com] *[http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/378086 Game at newgrounds.com] [[Category:2007 controversies]] [[Category:2007 video games]] [[Category:Flash games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Obscenity controversies in video gaming]] [[Category:Video games developed in Australia]] [[Category:Video games set in 2007]] [[Category:Video games set in Virginia]] [[Category:Violence in video games]] [[Category:Virginia Tech shooting]]

{{EngvarB|date=January 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Vasylkiv terrorists case | image = | caption = | location = [[Boryspil]], Ukraine | target = [[Statue of Lenin]] | date = 24 August 2011 ([[Independence Day of Ukraine]]) <small>By then the statue had been already removed.<ref name=VT25112tUW/></small> | time = | timezone = | type = Attempted [[bombing]] | fatalities = | injuries = 0 | perps = | susperps = | weapons =Explosives }} The '''Vasylkiv terrorists case''' is an alleged terror plot of three far-right activists ("the [[Vasylkiv]] terrorists"<ref name=IUVt13114/>) trying to blow up a [[statue of Lenin]] in the Ukrainian city [[Boryspil]] in August 2011.<ref name=BLb11114EN>[http://www.euronews.com/2014/01/11/dozens-hurt-as-fresh-clashes-erupt-in-ukraine/ Dozens hurt as fresh clashes erupt in Ukraine], [[Euronews]] (11 January 2014)</ref> The statue was removed in June 2011.<ref name=VT25112tUW/> The three suspects were arrested on 22 August 2011.<ref name=BLb11114RT/><ref name=AVTIU23811/>
Immediately after the three defendants were jailed for six years on 10 January 2014, violent clashes between the [[Ukrainian police]] and about a hundred protesters that had gathered at the courthouse broke out.<ref name=BLb11114EN/><ref name=BLb11114NYT/><ref name=BLb11114BBCN/>
Following the [[2014 Ukrainian revolution]], on February 24 they were released.
==Alleged 2011 bomb plot== Allegedly Volodymyr Shpara, [[Ihor Mosiychuk]] and Serhiy Bevza had plotted to blow up [[statue of Lenin]] in Boryspil on [[Independence Day of Ukraine]] on 24 August 2011.<ref name=BLb11114RT>[http://rt.com/news/ukraine-trial-protest-clashes-460/ Ukraine ex-minister injured as terror trial protesters clash with riot police], [[RT (TV network)]] (11 January 2014)</ref> Shpara, Mosiychuk and Bevza were arrested on 22 August 2011 by the [[Security Service of Ukraine]] (SBU), after the SBU discovered a home-made explosive device and extremist leaflets in the office of "[[Patriot of Ukraine (organization)|Patriot of Ukraine]]" organisation in [[Vasylkiv]] in a premises owned by Vasylkiv City Council.<ref name=BLb11114RT/><ref name=AVTIU23811>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/77439.html SBU opens criminal case against 'Vasylkiv terrorists'], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (23 August 2011)</ref> Shpara, Mosiychuk and Bevza denied the accusations and accused law enforcers of planting the bomb and leaflets on them.<ref name=BLb11114RT/><ref name=AVTIU23811/> According to SBU spokeswoman Maryna Ostapenko (as stated on 23 August 2011) "In addition to the explosive device, SBU officers also found a huge number of leaflets calling for extremist actions. The seized electronic medium containing a video showing schemes for blocking public institutions and producing improvised explosive devices, and one of the [[Directory (computing)|folders]] even contains videos of [[child pornography]]".<ref name=AVTIU23811/> Initially the SBU suspected a plot to detonate a bomb during the celebration of Ukraine's Independence Day in [[Kiev]].<ref name=AVTIU23811/> Before the alleged plot was discovered the Boryspil City Council had voted to remove the (alleged target) Lenin statue.<ref name=BLb11114NYT/> The statue of Lenin in Boryspil was removed in June 2011 by the city's authorities.<ref name=VT25112tUW>{{uk icon}} [http://tyzhden.ua/News/40353 "Васильківським терористам" приписують намір підірвати неіснуючий пам’ятник Леніну ''Vasylkiv terrorists being charged with an attempt to blow up a non-existing monument''], [[The Ukrainian Week]] (25 January 2012)</ref>
Shpara, Mosiychuk and Bevza became known as "the Vasylkiv terrorists".<ref name=VT25112tUW/><ref name=IUVt13114>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/185569.html Kyiv urges foreign diplomats to show restraint in regarding Ukraine], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (13 January 2014)</ref><ref name=AVTIU23811/>
On 10 January 2014 the three defendants were jailed for six years beyond the two years they have already spent in pre-trial detention.<ref name=BLb11114EN/><ref name=BLb11114NYT>[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/11/world/europe/new-clashes-erupt-in-ukraine-after-trial.html?_r=0 New Clashes Erupt in Ukraine After Trial], [[The New York Times]] (10 January 2014)</ref><ref name=BLb11114KP>[http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/lutsenko-hospitalized-as-authorities-face-political-repercussions-334869.html Lutsenko hospitalized as authorities face political fallout], ''[[Kyiv Post]]'' (11 January 2014)</ref> Their defenders had stated that the crime never took place, that the statue had already been removed and police planted evidence to convict the three of a trumped-up charge.<ref name=BLb11114KP/> According to the [[Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine]] someone had thrown an unidentified substance in the judge's face during the pronouncement of the sentence.<ref>[http://www.interfax.com/newsinf.asp?id=471829 Twenty policemen injured in clash with protesters in Kyiv – Interior Ministry], [[Interfax]] (11 January 2014)</ref>
==Protests (on 10 January 2014)== The sentencing of the three suspected bomb plotters on 10 January 2014 sparked violent clashes between the [[Ukrainian police]] and about 100 protesters that had gathered at the courthouse in [[Kiev]] for the verdict.<ref name=BLb11114EN/><ref name=BLb11114NYT/><ref name=BLb11114BBCN/> The clash between police and protesters lasted overnight until 2 a.m. on 11 January 2014.<ref name=BLb11114KP/> The protesters had denounced the prosecution of the three men as politically motivated and a show trial.<ref name=BLb11114NYT/> After the verdict they blocked the courthouse exit in an attempt to prevent police from taking the three convicts to prison.<ref name=BLb11114LAT>[http://www.latimes.com/world/worldnow/la-fg-wn-ukraine-opposition-leader-20140111,0,3338928.story#axzz2q2LeQTMX Ukraine opposition leader injured in clash with police], ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' (11 January 2014)</ref> After police had broken through the crowd protesters along the route then blocked the vehicles that attempted to transport the convicts by surrounding them with private cars and puncturing tires.<ref name=BLb11114LAT/> More police buses with at least 400 riot police then arrived.<ref name=BLb11114LAT/> The following clashes between police and protesters left dozens of people injured,<ref name=BLb11114EN/> including former [[Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine|Minister of Internal Affairs]] [[Yuriy Lutsenko]].<ref name=BLb11114EN/> (Who had arrived at the courthouse after the 400 riot police had arrived.<ref name=BLb11114LAT/>) According to Lutsenko's wife Iryna her husband had been attacked by police as he tried to break up the violence.<ref name=BLb11114BBCN>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-25692076 Ukraine ex-minister Lutsenko hurt in clashes in Kiev], [[BBC News]] (11 January 2014)</ref> Lutsenko was hospitalised in an intensive care ward.<ref name=BLb11114EN/> According to MP from [[Svoboda (party)|Svoboda]] [[Yuriy Syrotiuk]] over ten activists, several journalists and three fellow MPs and Svoboda party members ([[Eduard Leonov]], [[Yuriy Bublyk]] and [[Pavlo Kyrylenko]]) were injured.<ref name=Berkut10114>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/185432.html Three MPs, over dozen activists seriously injured in clash with Berkut, says Svoboda], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (11 January 2014)</ref> According to Syrotiuk the [[Berkut (Ukraine)|Berkut]] [[riot police]] had violated official instructions and had hit people's heads.<ref name=Berkut10114/> 20 Berkut were injured; one with a broken leg.<ref name=BLb11114RT/>
The event took place amid ongoing [[Euromaidan]] anti-government rallies.<ref name=BLb11114EN/> Just before the event took place, the Automaidan movement had blockaded buses carrying policemen.<ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/185422.html Ex-Ukrainian interior minister Lutsenko injured in clash with police, hospitalized – statement], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (11 January 2014)</ref>
==Reactions on protests== European Union and US officials condemned the violence against demonstrators.<ref name=BLb11114KP/> US Ambassador to Ukraine [[Geoffrey R. Pyatt]] stated "[[Yuriy Lutsenko]] will be remembered as hero of EuroMaidan" (for trying to intervene in the confrontation between police and protesters).<ref name=BLb11114KP/>
According to the Ukrainian authorities the verdict of 10 January had nothing to do with [[Euromaidan]], but according to the [[Ukrainian Foreign Ministry]] "Some MPs, hiding behind their status as [[People's Deputy of Ukraine|people's deputies of Ukraine]], entered into a violent confrontation with police, blocked the courthouse and the roadway around it. At the same time, the results of a medical examination of those who suffered in clashes with the police reveal some facts of them being in a state of [[alcoholic intoxication]]. This also concerns one prominent opposition politician".<ref name=IUVt13114/>
Ukraine's (then) ruling [[Party of Regions]] condemned the "assault" on the court and accused Svoboda of "provocation".<ref name=BLb11114RT/> The party said in a statement on 11 January 2013 "It's perplexing that those who support [[European values]], and a [[Ukraine–European Union relations|European path for Ukraine]], support terrorists. The Party of Regions condemns any terrorist activities or plotting such activities".<ref name=BLb11114RT/>
The [[Judicial system of Ukraine#Prosecution|prosecutor's office of Kiev]] launched a probe into allegations of [[abuse of authority]] by riot police officers the day following the riots.<ref>[http://www.ctvnews.ca/world/opposition-leader-yuri-lutsenko-injured-in-clashes-in-ukrainian-capital-1.1634667 Opposition leader Yuri Lutsenko injured in clashes in Ukrainian capital], [[CTV News]] (11 January 2014)</ref><ref>[http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/185401.html Kyiv prosecutor opens criminal case on abuse of power by Berkut police in recent clashes], [[Interfax-Ukraine]] (11 January 2014)</ref>

November (West Coast) | genre = [[Christian rock]], [[Christian rap]], [[contemporary Christian music]] | website = {{URL|http://www.jamtour.com}} }} '''Winter Jam Tour Spectacular''', also referred to as simply '''Winter Jam''' (and formerly known as '''January Jam''' from 1995–2000), is an annual American music tour featuring [[contemporary Christian music]] artists of all genres, [[stunt]] and/or [[comedy]] performances, as well as a tour speaker. It is the United States' largest annual Christian Music Tour.{{cite web|url=http://www.charismanews.com/culture/33231-winter-jam-shatters-records-as-worlds-no-1-tour |title=Winter Jam Shatters Records as World's No. 1 Tour |publisher=Charismanews.com |accessdate=May 30, 2014}} Conceived and created in 1995 as "January Jam" by contemporary Christian music group [[NewSong]] and produced and promoted by the promotions company, Premier Productions, Winter Jam has run annually since 1995. From its inception in 1995 through the most recent 2016 tour, the Winter Jam Tour Spectacular has toured all over the United States of America. Tickets are not required for the tour, as a $10 general admission is collected at the door of each arena,{{cite web|url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/plumb-joins-lineup-at-winter-jam-tour-spectacular-2014-with-newsboys-lecrae-108443/ |title=Plumb Joins Lineup at Winter Jam Tour Spectacular 2014 With Newsboys, Lecrae |work=The Christian Post |date=November 9, 2013 |accessdate=May 30, 2014}} though this was raised to a $15 suggested donation in 2018.{{cite web|title=FAQs|url=http://2018.jamtour.com/about/faq|website=Winter Jam|accessdate=February 27, 2018}} In 2010 the tour was rated the number two tour in the world.{{cite web|url=https://www.cbn.com/cbnmusic/news/winter-jam-no-2-tour-worldwide.aspx |title=Winter Jam Ranks as No. 2 Tour Worldwide: Christian Music News |publisher=Cbn.com |accessdate=May 30, 2014}} As of April 2011, they reported more than half a million in total attendance for the Winter Jam Tour Spectacular 2011, first quarter, attendance, and 90,000 "[[Decision theology|decisions for Christ]]" for. The tour outpaced attendance for all other tours in the first quarter of 2011, including Bon Jovi, U2, X Factor Live, Lady Gaga, Brad Paisley and Justin Bieber, according to Pollstar's 2011 Worldwide First Quarter Ticket Sales "Top 100 Tour" chart.{{cite press release |title=Winter Jam Makes History, Ranked #1 Tour In The World |publisher=Turning Point PR |date=April 18, 2011 |url=http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/news/2011/04/18.WINTER%20JAM%20MAKES%20HISTORY%20RANKED%20No.1%20TOUR%20IN%20THE%20WORLD.asp |accessdate=January 12, 2013}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|1=http://www.jamtour.com}} [[Category:Winter Jam Tour Spectacular]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 1995]] [[Category:Rock festivals in the United States]] [[Category:Christian music festivals]] [[Category:Christian concert tours]]
